artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Wakasaya Yoichi
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
An old story about how the pond was named Otamgaike. Originally this pond was called Sakuragaike (cherry pond) because of the big cherry tree by the pond. There was a woman serving tea under the cherry tree to the travellers passing by the pond. Her name was Tama and she was a very beautiful woman. Many male customers fell in love with her. Two of them were especially into her. But something happened. (Sorry I can\'t read that part)
She finally committed suicide by jumping into the pond. Since then, people have been calling the pond Otamagaike (Tama\'s pond) in memory of her.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Old Landmarks of the Eastern Capital (Tōto kyūseki zukushi)
title: Old Story of the Otama Pond in Kanda
